intro: Neurolepis asymmetrica, commonly known as the asymmetric leaf neurolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its distinctive, asymmetrical leaves that give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Neurolepis asymmetrica is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique biome in South Africa.
